data.title: Legacy of ... GG Allin by The Kings of Punk
data.meta_description: A return to your regularly scheduled programming... or at least, a program that was scheduled ahead of time. But nothing "regular" to be found here... THE KINGS offer an overview of the OUTLAW SCUMFUC himself. A daunting task and an episode sure to provoke listeners and elicit strong opinions, just like the man himself. Please do share those opinions with the Troika via kingsofpunk.com and/or @koppodofficial on Instagram.
data.text:
A jam-packed, full-ass-length episode of the Kings of Punk Podcast tackling a backlog of listener emails that's been piling up since the previous "Mailbag" episode in November of 2023. Your favorite hardcore punk and subculture commentary troika dive headfirst into the inbox to address your burning questions, impassioned rants, and hilarious stories (introducing Volume 1 of "The Coworker Chronicles") - expect both the width and breadth of topics to exceed mere hard core musings.

In addition, the troika shares some big news about the future of the podcast. For reasons that will become clear during the episode, they plan on taking a brief hiatus after this dip into the mailbag. Don't worry, punk's not dead and it's not the end of the world (or the podcast) - they plan to return be better than ever with new episodes and more hardcore and punk rock insight.

Website: KingsOfPunk.com

IG: https://www.instagram.com/koppodofficial/

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPj6iMRyW0GAJnxv9i7TAdQ

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/show/6bSFPxIqSr6kxkgqsRZBvN

Apple Podcasts: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-kings-of-punk/id1541490418

KOPPOD's latest installment in their "Legacy of..." series delves into the influential sounds of 80s straight edge titans, Youth of Today. A band known for their raw energy and impactful lyrics, this edition promises to explore the impact and legacy of a group that helped shape the hardcore music genre and subculture. The Kings of Punk trace the band's journey from Danbury, CT to a central role in New York's punk underground alongside greats like Agnostic Front, with the group developing their sound and making a greater and greater impact on the American hardcore scene as they developed the straight edge ethos pioneered by hardcore musicians like Ian Mackaye and Kevin Seconds. The band's relationship with Krishna Consciousness and role in the early development of "Krishnacore" also receives some attention. Stay tuned for an in-depth journey through the roots of both the "Youth Crew" subculture and the subgenre associated with it.

Website: kingsofpunk.com

IG: @koppodofficial

Our team at KOPPOD Punk Podcast apologize for the delay in releasing this episode; we put great effort into providing you with a great episode every week, but balancing this with other endeavors sometimes proves infeasible - especially when we add special musical intros for special episodes, the creation of which does NOT waste two of our hours and will NOT waste two of your minutes for no reason whatsoever.

Anyway, just in time for April, enjoy the FINALS of our MARCH MAYHEM series. 9 SHOCKS TERROR, BASTARD, POISON IDEA, and INITIAL STATE find themselves seated upon the scales of judgement as the troika makes their final selection. Give it a listen and let us know what you think!

PRANK RECORDS TOP 100: https://prankrecords.blogspot.com/2012/10/best-of-90s-diy-hardcore-top-100.html

Kingsofpunk.com

@koppodofficial on IG

the KOPPOD TROIKA push through the next two rounds of MARCH MAYHEM, lots of hard decisions on this very hardcore podcast. Heavy hitters pitted against one another; classic records revered by old school listeners and new generations alike. How do these three guys judge this segment of DIY HC History? Stay tuned as they delve into the essence of this music and emerge with their verdicts. Who will reach the Semifinals? and the FINAL? Give it a listen and find out. Get ready for deep dives and disruptive upsets, as you've come to expect from the KINGS OF PUNK PODCAST

PRANK RECORDS TOP 100: https://prankrecords.blogspot.com/2012/10/best-of-90s-diy-hardcore-top-100.html

Kingsofpunk.com

@koppodofficial on IG

The heaviest of hitters go head-to-head, with upsets and cinderella runs to boot! In this round, our returning guest Mike from the First Seven Inch Club podcast tags in for every matchup - taking the place of one of your beloved KOPPOD co-hosts (chosen at random), and bringing his perspective to these hardcore clashes. This round includes more excitement and tension than either of the first two rounds. Wanna find out who moves forward and who gets left behind? Give it a listen!

First Seven Inch Club: https://www.podbean.com/podcast-detail/9ehaq-52351/First-Seven-Inch-Club-%28AKA-Border-Boss%29-Podcast

@firstseveninchclub on Instagram

Kingsofpunk.com

@koppodofficial on IG

Its a bit before March but the March Mayhem series has begun! The first round pits 72 records against each other and the Kings make the arduous trudge through the first round with the help of Special Referee Conner. Who will come out on top? Listen and find out, and let us know how wrong we are at Kingsofpunk.com or on instagram @koppodofficial

The kings are joined by special guest Conner to do a dive into longtime punk label Prank Records. Founder Ken Sanderson brought to light a myriad of bands from all over the world onto wax, as well as some significant reissues over the years. We discuss some of our favorite releases from his label as well as his Best of 90s DIY Hardcore Top 100 list as well which we will be doing this year for our March Mayhem series.

Kingsofpunk.com

@koppodofficial on IG

https://prankrecords.blogspot.com/2012/10/best-of-90s-diy-hardcore-top-100.html

The KOPPOD Troika revisits a previous segment where we explore the history of punk within a city this time choosing the "Mistake by the Lake" that is Cleveland, OH. Its a place that is oft maligned and misunderstood, and the hosts divulge their history with the city, the music, and the people and dive into some history of proto-, and proper punk.

March Mayhem Poll https://app.smartsheet.com/b/form/9458c23c71d24dfbb81d69329bd578cf

And as always, kingsofpunk.com for more info, feedback, etc.

A new episode on Monday, which we plan on making the norm going forward. THE KINGS start their episode with a brief tribute to deceased rock/proto-punk legend WAYNE KRAMER of the MC5. Brother Wayne pioneered the sound of punk rock and without him, we might not be doing any of this stuff.

After that, the KINGS delve into morbid recent events - specifically, the alleged crimes of one Justin Mohn. Justin Mohn, a now-infamous "overeducated white man", declared war on the United States Federal Government in a YouTube video posted to social media. The same YouTube video also featured Justin showing off his father Michael Mohn's (an Army Corps of Engineers employee) decapitated head in a plastic bag. Authorities found a large kitchen knife at the scene of the crime (which Justin Mohn had fled, headed for a National Guard Training Center - presumably targeting more federal employees). Grim stuff.

But this isn't "Kings of True Crime", this is a punk rock podcast. A music podcast more broadly. Your cohosts focus on Pennsylvania man Justin Mohn's very unique musical offerings. Justin Mohn's music, characterized by haunting melodies and thought-provoking lyrics, challenges conventional norms and pushes boundaries. That last sentence? That's how Justin Mohn's music should have been pitched when Justin Mohn emailed record labels. As you'll learn in this episode, the emails he actually sent did not say that. The KINGS compare his music with that of other musicians who killed people, and begin to touch on the concept of "Outsider Music".

In this latest serving of the Kings of Punk Podcast, your hosts go full-throttle into unpleasant territory. The first half of the podcast sees them dissect the eyebrow-raising, discourse-provoking fashion choice made by Kanye West - spotted rocking a t-shirt for contentious, notorious, neuroatypical Black Metal artist BURZUM. Expect a mix of incisive commentary and indecent banter as always.

In the second half of this episode, the Kings of Punk switch gears to thrash the musical monstrosity that is 'Punk Goes Crunk.' If you've ever wondered why this album even exists, you're not alone: your hosts pose the questions, "Who thought this was a good idea? Who the fuck greenlit this?" They explore how this ill-conceived album, which butchered rap (not "crunk") by forcibly fusing it with the worst music ever (whatever it is, not "punk"), has unfortunately influenced music. Prepare for a hilarious, perhaps grueling at times, listen as the KINGS move in for the KILL.

A return to your regularly scheduled programming... or at least, a program that was scheduled ahead of time. But nothing "regular" to be found here... THE KINGS offer an overview of the OUTLAW SCUMFUC himself. A daunting task and an episode sure to provoke listeners and elicit strong opinions, just like the man himself. Please do share those opinions with the Troika via kingsofpunk.com and/or @koppodofficial on Instagram.

After a few freeform epsiodes, the Kings conspire this week to discuss the 'Libero De Vivere / Libero De Morire' Album by Wretched. Perhaps overlooked in the modern streaming era, these punks from Milan, Italy would be a great start for anyone looking to get into something a little deeper than what you might find on an 80s HC playlist.

Stream/Download the album here: https://hdkpkk.bandcamp.com/album/pkk1-libero-di-vivere-libero-di-morire-1984

The veil grows thin, and the KOPPOD troika grew anxious to peel it back and examine a singular Los Angeles musical outfit. The absence of an episode last week no doubt caused some distress among our listeners, but hopefully no one wished for death without a new episode. This one makes up for it and then some; a real-deal deep dive into Christian Death, including an examination of other projects including Rozz Williams (RIP). Give it a listen and enjoy the holiday.

KOPPOD's Jake Razor conducts an interview with none other than GARRY BUSHELL. If you listened to Part One, you learned a bit about Garry; he managed the COCKNEY REJECTS, he curated the iconic 'Strength Thru Oi!' compilation (and the other great compilations in that series), he sang for the GONADS, and as a SOUNDS journalist he penned a mountain of words championing punk rock's misunderstood underdogs and UK subculture's quixotic tribespeople. This work and more continues to this day as Garry remains an active writer. For his part, Jake picks the man's brain about the austerity of 70s Britain, UK youth subculture tribes, reggae, punks vs. skinheads, and... British Trotskyite sects, briefly. Maybe we can get his take on Enver Hoxha next time. For now, check out this episode to hear a true powerhouse share insight on the aforementioned topics and much more.

Garry's website: http://www.garry-bushell.co.uk/

Music featured in this episode:

"TNT" by the Gonads (ft. our guest)

"Punk Rock Will Never Die" by the Gonads (you already know)

"Inner London Violence" by Bad Manners (not ft. Garry Bushell, but an appropriate interlude after the first half)

NEW STICKERS!!!: https://kingsofpunkpodcast.bigcartel.com/product/kill-your-local-band-sticker

Instagram: @koppodofficial

Website: kingsofpunk.com

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@kingsofpunkpodcast4349

The KOPPOD lads lead you on an overdue journey to late-70s England. This guided tour allows you to observe the birth of a sub-genre and subculture which left permanent marks on punk rock as a whole; bruises, tattoos, missing teeth, and much more. Part 1 of a 3-part series, this episode tackles the second-wave punk groups which served as the blueprint for Oi! bands to follow. Give it a listen and find out where all the bootboys came from. Check out the next two installments and find out where they gone.

Check out Fentanyl Tapwater (featuring the percussive stylings of Gary "U.S" Bombs) on tour:

Friday 9/29 at the Snake Pit in Philadelphia, PA

Saturday 9/30 at the Out Post in Fredericksburg, VA

Sunday 10/1 at Angry Mom Records in Ithaca, NY

NEW STICKERS!!!: https://kingsofpunkpodcast.bigcartel.com/product/kill-your-local-band-sticker

Instagram: @koppodofficial

Website: kingsofpunk.com

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@kingsofpunkpodcast4349

The Kings return from a trip to scenic, historic Troy, NY ... and embark on yet another journey, to the same place, but this time it's just a metaphorical journey. A metaphorical sojourn through the sights, sounds, words, and rhythms of the scenic, historic scene/musical style known as TROY-CORE. Fans of our earlier "Intro to Metalcore" episodes ought to like this one; Troy-Core inhabits a specific and crucial corner within the realm of 90s hardcore. If this "TROY-CORE" talk is all Greek to you, just give this episode a listen and the KINGS will provide the clarification you need. Is "TROY-CORE" a good type of music? Or is it a Trojan Horse smuggling James Hetfield, Lars Ulrich, Kirk Hammett, and Rob Trujillo into the Hardcore scene, right through the gates of Troy, NY? Check out this episode and find out for yourself.

NEW STICKERS!!!: https://kingsofpunkpodcast.bigcartel.com/product/kill-your-local-band-sticker

Instagram: @koppodofficial

Twitter: @kingsofpunkpod

Website: kingsofpunk.com

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@kingsofpunkpodcast4349

Shirley Road Records (use promocode "KOPPOD10"): https://shirleyroadrecords.com/index.php?main_page=products_all

In the wake of its 20th anniversary, the KINGS examine 'Guitar Romantic' by the EXPLODING HEARTS. A dawn-of-the-millenium milestone in the underground scene - and in light of its recent reissue and some retrospect articles from publications like Pitchfork and MTV News, it seemed appropriate for your hosts to give it a listen and share their thoughts. Find out what they thought on this new episode, and perhaps find an album you slept on (or an album you never heard before and don't like at all - you gotta listen to find out).

Third Man Reissue: https://thirdmanrecords.com/collections/exploding-hearts/products/guitar-romantic-expanded-remastered

NEW STICKERS!!!: https://kingsofpunkpodcast.bigcartel.com/product/kill-your-local-band-sticker

Instagram: @koppodofficial

Twitter: @kingsofpunkpod

Website: kingsofpunk.com

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@kingsofpunkpodcast4349

Shirley Road Records (use promocode "KOPPOD10"): https://shirleyroadrecords.com/index.php?main_page=products_all

(Intro Song: "Don't Give a Fuck" by the SPIDER BABIES)

The Kings once again discuss new music and they don't limit it to punk. Beware, some tracks on this episode may hurt your ears. Please let us know any new tunes you enjoy, lots of stuff we end up missing.

Rat Cage: https://lavidaesunmus.bandcamp.com/album/savage-visions

Axxe Crazy: https://roachlegrecords.bandcamp.com/album/black-winds-blowing-an-indifferent-sky

Bogside Sniper Squadron: https://bogsidesnipersquadron.bandcamp.com/album/demo-2023

Pleasure Dome: https://pleasuredomemusic.bandcamp.com/album/ellie

NEW STICKERS!!!: https://kingsofpunkpodcast.bigcartel.com/product/kill-your-local-band-sticker

Instagram: @koppodofficial

Twitter: @kingsofpunkpod

Website: kingsofpunk.com

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@kingsofpunkpodcast4349

Shirley Road Records (use promocode "KOPPOD10"): https://shirleyroadrecords.com/index.php?main_page=products_all

The Kings return to the Reunion Retribution format to discuss some albums by heralded and underground UK82 acts, continuing the recent discussion of the genre. We have some ups and downs discussing Varukers, Skeptix, and The Violators and their reunion releases. Did these acts embrace the street punk trends, keep it old school, or find a new sound to run with? You'll hear it on this episode.

NEW STICKERS!!!: https://kingsofpunkpodcast.bigcartel.com/product/kill-your-local-band-sticker

Instagram: @koppodofficial

Twitter: @kingsofpunkpod

Website: kingsofpunk.com

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@kingsofpunkpodcast4349

Shirley Road Records (use promocode "KOPPOD10"): https://shirleyroadrecords.com/index.php?main_page=products_all

Jake Razor reports back from his high-octane weekend in the Motor City. To be precise, he provides a rundown of TIED DOWN FEST; a stacked Hardcore Hullaballoo featuring TRAPPED UNDER ICE, NEGATIVE APPROACH, DRAIN, HATE5SIX THE VIDEOGRAPHER, and a cornucopia of other acts. What'd he make of it? What do the Kings make of Hardcore in June 2023? What's the best spot for late-night Yemeni food? Listen to this episode and find out.

NEW STICKERS!!!: https://kingsofpunkpodcast.bigcartel.com/product/kill-your-local-band-sticker

Instagram: @koppodofficial

Twitter: @kingsofpunkpod

Website: kingsofpunk.com

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@kingsofpunkpodcast4349

Shirley Road Records (use promocode "KOPPOD10"): https://shirleyroadrecords.com/index.php?main_page=products_all

This episode, there is no holding back. With Jake being away for the weekend, the remaining Kings of Punk call in their allies Special Guest Conner as well as Cougar to whip up a powerful episode that takes no prisoners. Parental advisory for those that might be easily offended, but this isn't your normal Kings of Punk Podcast!

NEW STICKERS!!!: https://kingsofpunkpodcast.bigcartel.com/product/kill-your-local-band-sticker

Instagram: @koppodofficial

Twitter: @kingsofpunkpod

Website: kingsofpunk.com

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@kingsofpunkpodcast4349

Shirley Road Records (use promocode "KOPPOD10"): https://shirleyroadrecords.com/index.php?main_page=products_all

GLUE your ears to a podcast platform of your choice, and get all CHARGED up and ready for a new episode of the KINGS OF PUNK PODCAST. Your time listening shall be well-spent; you won't feel EXPLOITED after spending some time with.... goddamnit this schtick sucks, I'm really sorry everybody. Today's episode examines what music fans may know as the "UK82" milieu. The Troika examines classic British hardcore punk bands of the early 80s, through the lens of both British society at that time and our own home of American subculture from then to now. Featuring a few musical samplings and discussion of some classic acts. This episode lays the groundwork for future episodes regarding STREET PUNK and much more. "Pogo" "Anti-Nowhere League" "5 G C0R0N@V1RU$" "1337 w@rez"

The Kings are down one this week as we are joined by special guest Conner and scramble to come up with an episode. That doesn't mean there isn't anyhting here worth listening, but next week will be a real hitter. We talk One Sided Lps, Being in Hollywood, the punk validitiy of Riot Fest, and so much more.

ON SYRUP HEAD GOFUNDME: https://www.gofundme.com/f/4nc2d-family-home-burned?utm_campaign=p_cp+share-sheet&utm_content=undefined&utm_medium=copy_link_all&utm_source=customer&utm_term=undefined
